byline.original: By ELVIRE CAMUS AND RACHEL RAMSAY

abstract: Security workers are protesting staff cuts.
snippet: Security workers are protesting staff cuts.
lead_paragraph: PARIS -- A strike by workers at the Musée d'Orsay postponed the long-awaited reopening of the museum's newly renovated galleries on Thursday. Some 34 employees, mostly security guards, staged the walkout to protest the fact that no additional workers had been recruited at the museum despite the addition of more than 21,000 square feet of display space, a museum spokeswoman said. That decision was made amid broad government cutbacks that see retiring civil servants - including museum workers - not replaced by new hires.

headline.main: Strike at Revamped Musée d'Orsay Blocks Grand Reopening
